item.title: Crisis of faith in election manifesto
item.description: THE voting period for the 13th National Parliament election is now only hours away. Mostpoliticalparties and candidates have put forward their pledges in their election manifestos. In Bangladesh, election day is traditionally very festive. This time, however, the occasion is overshadowed by the loss and sacrifices of the July 2024 uprising, transforming what is usually......Politics

item.title: What role can civil society play?
item.description: BANGLADESH stands at a rare and delicate historical juncture. After years marked by heavy-handed governance, systemic corruption and widespread rights abuses, the political order that had dominated national life for more than a decade finally collapsed under the weight of its own excesses. Numerous Bangladeshis experienced suffering that cannot be easily erased......

item.title: Post-mortem of the election campaign
item.description: FOR decades, the political landscape of Bangladesh was defined by the battle of the Begums. This was, in effect, a bitter binary between Khaleda Zia and Sheikh Hasina, dominated by smear campaigns in which Hasina’s Awami League branded Khaleda’s BNP as ‘anti-liberation’, while the BNP labelled the Awami League as India’s dalal, meaning ‘pro-Indian’. Today, both......

item.title: Corruption that infests ACC warrants deterrent action
